abstract: Dewey Bozella makes his professional boxing debut in Los Angeles after serving 26 years in prison and then being exonerated in 1977 killing in Poughkeepsie; it is first and last fight for Bozella, who plans to open boxing ring as way to mentor young people, especially troubled kids.
snippet: Dewey Bozella fought in Los Angeles after serving 26 years in prison and then being exonerated in a 1977 killing in Poughkeepsie.
lead_paragraph: Dewey Bozella fought in Los Angeles after serving 26 years in prison and then being exonerated in a 1977 killing in Poughkeepsie.

headline.main: At 52, an Exonerated Man Is Victorious in the Ring
headline.print_headline: At 52, an Exonerated Man Is Victorious in the Ring
headline.seo: Dewey Bozella, Cleared of Murder, Wins Boxing Debut
